html:
PC Number Date Chapter Bill Dept
 2022-12452022-11-25,  ,  ,  ,  TC, 
ActAeronautics Act
SubjectRegulations Amending the Canadian Aviation Regulations (Various Amendments, 2021)
PrecisRegulations Amending the CANADIAN AVIATION REGULATIONS (VARIOUS AMENDMENTS, 2021) in order to (1) clarify requirements for grid maps and airport wildlife management plans; (2) remove the requirement for the Minister of Transport to interview the individual responsible for maintenance in various types of organizations; (3) add to the list of responsibilities for the maintenance manager, the person responsible for maintenance, and the person responsible for the maintenance control system the responsibility of removing an aircraft from operation; (4) repeal the obligation for the certificate holder to authorize the maintenance manager, the person responsible for maintenance, and the person responsible for the maintenance control system to remove an aircraft from operation; (5) clarify the categorization of level 1 incidents with a crew member; (6) clarify language regarding legal names of individuals and entities; (7) codify flight and duty time regulations; and (8) codify the requirements for manufacturer names on aircraft identification plates.
RegistrationRegistration: SOR/ 2022-0246 Publication Date: 2022-12-07
AttachmentsAttachment
subject: Regulations Amending the Canadian Aviation Regulations (Various Amendments, 2021)
precis: Regulations Amending the CANADIAN AVIATION REGULATIONS (VARIOUS AMENDMENTS, 2021) in order to (1) clarify requirements for grid maps and airport wildlife management plans; (2) remove the requirement for the Minister of Transport to interview the individual responsible for maintenance in various types of organizations; (3) add to the list of responsibilities for the maintenance manager, the person responsible for maintenance, and the person responsible for the maintenance control system the responsibility of removing an aircraft from operation; (4) repeal the obligation for the certificate holder to authorize the maintenance manager, the person responsible for maintenance, and the person responsible for the maintenance control system to remove an aircraft from operation; (5) clarify the categorization of level 1 incidents with a crew member; (6) clarify language regarding legal names of individuals and entities; (7) codify flight and duty time regulations; and (8) codify the requirements for manufacturer names on aircraft identification plates.
